metadata.description: Used to name all resources
Are you providing your own vNet CIDR blocks
Full resource id path of an existing subnet to use for AKS
Full resource id path of an existing subnet to use for Application Gateway
Installs the AKS KV CSI provider
Creates a Key Vault
If soft delete protection is enabled
If purge protection is enabled
Add IP to firewall whitelist
Create an Azure Firewall
Create an Application Gateway
A known private ip in the Application Gateway subnet range to be allocated for internal traffic
The SKU for AppGw
Enable the WAF Firewall, valid for WAF_v2 SKUs
Create, and use a new Log Analytics workspace for AKS logs
The System Pool Preset sizing
Diagnostic categories to log
Enable Metric Alerts
Which Metric polling frequency model to use
The Log Analytics retention period

variables.appGWskuObj: [union(createObject('name', parameters('appGWsku'), 'tier', parameters('appGWsku')), if(equals(parameters('appGWmaxCount'), 0), createObject('capacity', parameters('appGWcount')), createObject()))]

metadata.description: A subnet address for the Azure Firewall
Whitelist dnsZone name (required by cert-manager validation process)

properties.rules: [concat(createArray(createObject('name', 'aks', 'protocols', createArray(createObject('port', 443, 'protocolType', 'Https'), createObject('port', 80, 'protocolType', 'Http')), 'targetFqdns', createArray(), 'fqdnTags', createArray('AzureKubernetesService'), 'sourceAddresses', createArray(parameters('vnetAksSubnetAddressPrefix')))), if(parameters('certManagerFW'), createArray(createObject('name', 'cetman-quay', 'protocols', createArray(createObject('port', 443, 'protocolType', 'Https'), createObject('port', 80, 'protocolType', 'Http')), 'targetFqdns', createArray('quay.io', '*.quay.io'), 'sourceAddresses', createArray(parameters('vnetAksSubnetAddressPrefix'))), createObject('name', 'cetman-letsencrypt', 'protocols', createArray(createObject('port', 443, 'protocolType', 'Https'), createObject('port', 80, 'protocolType', 'Http')), 'targetFqdns', createArray('letsencrypt.org', '*.letsencrypt.org'), 'sourceAddresses', createArray(parameters('vnetAksSubnetAddressPrefix')))), createArray()), if(and(parameters('certManagerFW'), not(empty(parameters('appDnsZoneName')))), createArray(createObject('name', 'cetman-appDnsZoneName', 'protocols', createArray(createObject('port', 443, 'protocolType', 'Https'), createObject('port', 80, 'protocolType', 'Http')), 'targetFqdns', createArray(parameters('appDnsZoneName'), format('*.{0}', parameters('appDnsZoneName'))), 'sourceAddresses', createArray(parameters('vnetAksSubnetAddressPrefix')))), createArray()))]

[concat(createArray(createObject('name', 'ControlPlaneTCP', 'protocols', createArray('TCP'), 'sourceAddresses', createArray(parameters('vnetAksSubnetAddressPrefix')), 'destinationAddresses', createArray(format('AzureCloud.{0}', parameters('location'))), 'destinationPorts', createArray('9000', '22')), createObject('name', 'ControlPlaneUDP', 'protocols', createArray('UDP'), 'sourceAddresses', createArray(parameters('vnetAksSubnetAddressPrefix')), 'destinationAddresses', createArray(format('AzureCloud.{0}', parameters('location'))), 'destinationPorts', createArray('1194')), createObject('name', 'AzureMonitorForContainers', 'protocols', createArray('TCP'), 'sourceAddresses', createArray(parameters('vnetAksSubnetAddressPrefix')), 'destinationAddresses', createArray('AzureMonitor'), 'destinationPorts', createArray('443'))), if(parameters('acrPrivatePool'), createArray(createObject('name', 'acr-agentpool', 'protocols', createArray('TCP'), 'sourceAddresses', createArray(parameters('acrAgentPoolSubnetAddressPrefix')), 'destinationAddresses', createArray('AzureKeyVault', 'Storage', 'EventHub', 'AzureActiveDirectory', 'AzureMonitor'), 'destinationPorts', createArray('443'))), createArray()))]

metadata.description: The name of the AKS Cluster to configure the alerts on
The name of the Log Analytics workspace to log metric data to
The location of the Log Analytics workspace
Select the frequency on how often the alert rule should be run. Selecting frequency smaller than granularity of datapoints grouping will result in sliding window evaluation
Create the metric alerts as either enabled or disabled
Defines the interval over which datapoints are grouped using the aggregation type function

resources.name: [format('Node CPU utilization high for {0} CI-1', parameters('clusterName'))]

properties.description: Node CPU utilization across the cluster.

resources.name: [format('Node working set memory utilization high for {0} CI-2', parameters('clusterName'))]

properties.description: Node working set memory utilization across the cluster.

resources.name: [format('Jobs completed more than 6 hours ago for {0} CI-11', parameters('clusterName'))]

properties.description: This alert monitors completed jobs (more than 6 hours ago).

resources.name: [format('Container CPU usage high for {0} CI-9', parameters('clusterName'))]

properties.description: This alert monitors container CPU utilization.

resources.name: [format('Container working set memory usage high for {0} CI-10', parameters('clusterName'))]

properties.description: This alert monitors container working set memory utilization.

resources.name: [format('Pods in failed state for {0} CI-4', parameters('clusterName'))]

properties.description: This alert monitors disk usage for all nodes and storage devices.

resources.name: [format('Nodes in not ready status for {0} CI-3', parameters('clusterName'))]
[format('Containers getting OOM killed for {0} CI-6', parameters('clusterName'))]

properties.description: This alert monitors number of containers killed due to out of memory (OOM) error.

resources.name: [format('Persistent volume usage high for {0} CI-18', parameters('clusterName'))]

properties.description: This alert monitors persistent volume utilization.

resources.name: [format('Pods not in ready state for {0} CI-8', parameters('clusterName'))]

properties.description: This alert monitors for excessive pods not in the ready state.
This alert monitors number of containers restarting across the cluster.

resources.name: [format('Container CPU usage violates the configured threshold for {0} CI-19', parameters('clusterName'))]

properties.description: This alert monitors container CPU usage. It uses the threshold defined in the config map.

resources.name: [format('Container working set memory usage violates the configured threshold for {0} CI-20', parameters('clusterName'))]

properties.description: This alert monitors container working set memory usage. It uses the threshold defined in the config map.

resources.name: [format('PV usage violates the configured threshold for {0} CI-21', parameters('clusterName'))]

properties.description: This alert monitors PV usage. It uses the threshold defined in the config map.

resources.name: [format('Daily data cap breached for workspace {0} CIQ-1', parameters('logAnalyticsWorkspaceName'))]

properties.displayName: [format('Daily data cap breached for workspace {0} CIQ-1', parameters('logAnalyticsWorkspaceName'))]
properties.description: This alert monitors daily data cap defined on a workspace and fires when the daily data cap is breached.

allOf.query: _LogOperation | where Operation == "Data collection Status" | where Detail contains "OverQuota"
